description.narrative: (i) Increased Access to FCY Financing for SMEs: Limited access to finance is considered a key constraint to private sector growth. Increased access to finance is indispensable to grow the competitiveness of SMEs. By directly financing the short term US$ liquidity needs of OCB which in turn will support export oriented SMEs, particularly in the Southern region, where the Bank is establishing itself as a MSME bank, the Facility will make an important contribution to sustainable export-led economic growth in Vietnam. (ii) The Project is expected to have a positive impact on job preservation by partially bridging the foreign currency liquidity gap in export oriented businesses. This is especially important in an environment where a large number of SMEs have been severely affected by the continuing financial crisis. Financial support to SMEs is thus critical to employment preservation in adverse market conditions. Hence, the Project will have a direct impact on job preservation and employment generation through OCB''s financing of private-sector companies.

The purpose of the project is to support Orient Commercial Joint Stock Bank (OCB or the Bank) in providing USD liquidity to its trade-oriented Small Medium Enterprise (SME) clients. The proposed investment is an IFC A loan of up to US$ 10 million with a maturity of up to 12 months, renewable twice (3 year life in total) upon the Bank fulfilling conditions of renewal. The IFC financing will enable the Bank to continue to provide financing to trade-oriented SMEs in Vietnam for their exports, imports and working-capital needs.
